title: "the automatic system works"
body:
[REMOVED]

These two accounts are the same person.

notice one is plat, and the other has been bronze for 3 seasons and feeds literally every game they play.

if the automatic ban system worked they would be banned.

And i have hundreds of more cases just like this in my little "people who should be banned in my elo" vault.

And it gets bigger literally every day, now imagine if we still had a tribunal, so i wouldnt have to name and shame these people.

Hell most of the people that i believe should be banned ive reported dozens of times, it literally does nothing because the automatic system just doesnt fucking know they exist.

like out of literally hundreds upon hundreds, of completely legitmate reports, i have seen one person get banned, and the rest go on scot free ruining mine and other peoples experiences.

But of course i dont fucking matter, no one in my elo fucking matters, because we arent challenger.

Despite being literally the majority of your fucking playerbase.

replies.body:
Probably include how you have concluded that they're indeed the same person into the OP. The problem with name-and-shaming (hence generally discouraged or banned) besides that they kinda have to protect the dignity of those being reported as a basic premise, is that you could also potentially be accusing someone falsely without you knowing.

That said yes, having Tribunal back would be rather nice, I concur.

he spent an hour trying to convince us that was his main and that the only reason hes trolling bronze is because hes plat so he doesnt give a shit about this elo.

Let's lay the the argument down to compare between how they could indeed be the same person vs. how they could not be the same person (ie, the guy was just BS'ing, which isn't unheard of anyway considering the fact "im a diamond smurf" has already become a meme):

Argument for:

* Their naming pattern seems to match in terms of trends and traits for both accounts. The way they name their runes and/or masteries (the "main" no longer has mastery pages besides 1 left-over due to inactivity before seasonal wipe) do correlate in some manner. The pages are either named with proper acronyms and/or letter-casing, or they'd be casual naming/acronyms/letter-casing combined with dry humour. The catch seems to be that those 2 type of naming behaviour are almost completely independent from each other making it a distinct characteristic, and both of the 2 accounts seem to share that.
* The 2 seem to both favour Tahm and Riven to a certain extent, at least enough for 1 acc to play them somewhat often and for the "main" acc to have rune pages dedicated to them (though the "main" acc only played Riven once and Tahm none in their last 20 matches recorded in their profile).

Argument against:

* That "main" acc has been inactive for a little more than a full year, the last game in that acc was played in Oct 2015. I am not saying it's impossible, but the chances is rather low for someone to just leave their main behind for more than a year and play on their smurf only. Unless they got perm'ed or something otherwise I wouldn't bet too much money on that.
* The "main" acc have rune pages (since masteries are wiped with only 1 remain) dedicated to Diana, Riven, Tahm, jg Vi specifically, Cho'gath, Gangplank, a joke page supposedly for AP Malphite, and many shall we say, "generic" pages designed to cover some position without addressing specific champions ("fill" pages essentially); and the last mastery page remained was dedicated to Viktor. Meanwhile that 1 acc in question has all rune pages to be "generic", and the mastery pages are dedicated to Riven, Rammus, Mundo, Alistar, Olaf, and otherwise un-named or incomplete mastery pages. These 2 behaviours and preferences don't seem to be relate-able in this instance.

You could think this through the present them to the Rioter if needed. However, don't be too asserting, because you never know whether or not that guy was just bulls'ing after he'd dug up a seemingly abandoned account or that he was the legitimate owner of that supposed "main" who for whatever reason is now doing god knows what in low rank exclusively.

While technically smurfing isn't against the game's law (or is it now?), but if they're legit only dk'ing around as a smurf and occasionally behaving to avoid being banned by the system, I'm sure there are also ways around to deal with them, and if there isn't, at least this shall serve as a case study backing say the return of Tribunal, hopefully.

How exactly are you so sure they are the same person? That aside, no name and shame.

Also, that Bronze player, looks an inconsistent player, not an intent feeder. Being bad at the game isn't punishable.

And thats exactly why i dont trust your judement on who should and shouldnt be banned.

He was going to lock garen adc till i banned garen, then went nid adc instead.

proceeded to run it down his lane till he was 1/8 then repeatedly said he was going to afk.

Totally just an inconsistent player.

fyi the only reason he didnt afk was so he wouldnt get leaverbustered, since thats literally the only system riot has that works.

Point being there's only three games in his recent history that look like intent feeding, not all of them. "The automatic system works" and "the automatic system is perfect" are not one and the same. It cannot catch all of these players instantaneously.

hes been doing this for 3 years, if it cant catch someone who blatantly tries to ruin peoples games, for 3 years.

it cant catch shit.

Further more a 36% overall winrate is not inconsistent, thats consistently losing.

and i refuse to believe that the elo that i and other players i know are in, consists of people so bad at the game that they can have a 30% winrate, where as players like myself and my friends, have 60% + winrates, i dunno about you but thats extremely fishy to me.

infact whenever i see someone below 40% i instinctively go through their entire match history to check if they are a troll or not then report them if i believe they are, and if i deduce they arent a troll? well thats where most of my match making bitch posts come from, the fact that the mmr system is so inaccurate that i can be paired with or against someone with literally a third of my own winrate.

How do you know he's been doing it for three years? Because he's still in Bronze? The games where he isn't intenting look normal for his tier to me. I'm not saying he shouldn't have been caught after 8 games in recent history, but 3 years seems just a tad exaggerated to me.

heres the thing you are failing to recognize seras,

Smurf trolls dont just consistently feed, they make an effort to win a game or two every now and then, why? because if they dont they sink below their favorite kiddy pool of players to an elo where they cant feed hard enough to cause losses.

infact i know of a pair of smurf trolls that still arent fucking banned a year later despite me reporting them both atleast 50 fucking times each.

Who literally go out of their way to tilt their teams even more by carrying them hard and then suddenly going afk.

you cant just look at a match history and look at the scores and get an idea of whether someone is an inter or not.

take my last game i got really fucking fed up with getting 3 retarded ass teams in a row.

So you know what i did? full ad kat ran it down mid, and i won, my score doesnt look like i inted because i didnt, but i sure as hell fucking went out of my way to tilt my team.

And guess what, nothings going to happen to me.

Just like nothing is going to happen to cozi2.

just like nothing is going to happen to sovietstalin.

just like nothing is going to happen to anyone.

You can keep defending this system as much as you want, but you wont convince anyone, because the people that actually fucking deal with this shit every day.

The people who get driven to being toxic themselves.

We fucking know it doesnt work.

I dont enjoy playing league of legends, and its not because of the bad teams.

Its not because i dont enjoy the actual game itself (i do otherwise id have stopped playing it ages ago)

i dont enjoy league of legends, because the community is so fucking far gone into the realm of toxicity, that its literally a miracle when i get a full game of people who arent toxic.

ive played almost 100 games already in season 7.

ive had 2 games that didnt have an afk or a troll or a flamer in them, on either team.

thats 98% chance of getting a toxic player on the team.

How the fuck can you justify this system with odds like that.

I'm obviously not going to convince you. I see the system working in the vast majority of cases. You see the system not working at all.

Speaking in absolutes is hardly going to get us anywhere and it only invalidates arguments.

I don't think the system is perfect. I do think that player should get a 14 day ban if he hasn't been punished before. I don't think he is intent-ing every game, nor even most games. I don't think he has been doing this for 3 years.

That was a day ago, but it seems like the system is not working in this players case. According to op.gg they int in each flex queue game.

[Have a look here.](http://imgur.com/a/wyyKi)

If you see their op.gg, they are a reasonable player, but just intentionally feed in flex queue, perhaps to have a laugh between their solo and flex rankings? Who knows. Anyways, the system is not working is the point.

He wasn't the player were were initially talking about, but I will acknowledge that the system does have trouble when it comes to more nuanced feeding (i.e when the games look alright but the player has been acting out in game in a way that would create a loss).

This is why these usually get passed along for manual investigation, since the player is getting a lot of reports but the system can't understand why. However if people stop reporting them, or if it is only a few of the same players reporting them then it may not get flagged.

If you see a player not being punished you can submit a support ticket and they'll take a look at it, though you'll get the macro "we can't disclose any information" response. I removed the pic from your post but I have passed it on.

I don't believe the system is perfect, but it frustrates me when people tell me it doesn't work _at all_ because I know it does a lot of good work for the community, and I feel that if you want to have a productive discussion you have to acknowledge both sides.

as much as you feel like he should get a 14-day he wont.

I know that for a fact.

infact if you want to make a wager on it, month from now if hes still not banned, you eat your words.

Because i guarantee you, he will keep doing it, he didnt get provoked, he just came into champ select already ready to troll.

if someone had pissed him off before hand, id accept that hes just pissed off, i mean i get toxic when im pissed off too.

But its the fact he just did it, out of the blue, for no reason, thats how i know he will keep doing it.

We dont call it elo hell because its hard to get out of.

We call it elo hell because the games literally feel like torture to play.
So get better and get out of "elo hell"
